gremlins

Class MovingObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • gremlins.GameObject
      • gremlins.MovingObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fireball, Freeze, Gremlin, Slime, Wizard

    public abstract class MovingObject
extends GameObject

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean alive
      Boolean that determines if object is alive as all moving objects can die
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Brick> bricks
      all moving objects need access to bricks
      protected boolean collide
      Boolean that determines if object has collided with another object
      protected java.lang.String direction
      every moving object has an direction
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Stone> stones
      all moving objects need access to stones
      protected int xVel
      every moving object has an x velocity
      protected int yVel
      every moving object has a y velocity

      • Fields inherited from class gremlins.GameObject

        sprite, x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      MovingObject(int x, int y, processing.core.PImage sprite) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkAlive(java.util.ArrayList<? extends MovingObject> movingObjects)
      Determines if object has already collided with a moving object, and if so, set alive attribute to false.
      void checkAliveBoth(java.util.ArrayList<? extends MovingObject> movingObjects)
      Determines if object has already collided with a moving object, and if so, set alive attribute of both object and moving object to false.
      void checkCollision(java.util.ArrayList<? extends GameObject> gameObjects, java.lang.String direction)
      Determines if this object moving in a certain direction results in a collision with an object specified in parameters, and if so sets attribute collide to false.

      • checkCollision

        public void checkCollision(java.util.ArrayList<? extends GameObject> gameObjects,
                           java.lang.String direction)
        Determines if this object moving in a certain direction results in a collision with an object specified in parameters, and if so sets attribute collide to false. Uses rectangle collision detection.
        Parameters:
        gameObjects: - An arraylist of types that extend game objects
        direction: - A string which indicates direction moving object will move

      • checkAlive

        public void checkAlive(java.util.ArrayList<? extends MovingObject> movingObjects)
        Determines if object has already collided with a moving object, and if so, set alive attribute to false.
        Parameters:
        movingObjects: - An arraylist of types that extend moving objects

      • checkAliveBoth

        public void checkAliveBoth(java.util.ArrayList<? extends MovingObject> movingObjects)
        Determines if object has already collided with a moving object, and if so, set alive attribute of both object and moving object to false.
        Parameters:
        movingObjects: - An arraylist of types that extend moving objects
